perturbation.original_text: During the Term PPI shall at its own cost and expense take all actions necessary to comply with all Applicable Laws and  obtain and maintain all necessary license, permits, records and authorizations PPI is required to obtain and maintain hereunder so as to  enable PPI to perform its obligations hereunder and under the Supply Agreement so as to enable EKR to fully exercise the Distribution  Rights.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term PPI shall at its own cost and expense take some actions necessary to comply with some Applicable Laws and  obtain and maintain some necessary licenses, permits, records and authorizations PPI is required to obtain and maintain hereunder so as to  enable PPI to perform its obligations hereunder and under the Supply Agreement so as to enable EKR to fully exercise the Distribution  Rights.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'all' to 'some' introduces ambiguity regarding the extent of PPI's legal compliance obligations, therefore, undermining the enforceability of this clause.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement and the relationship between the Parties shall be governed by, and interpreted in accordance with New  York law without regard to provisions related to conflicts of laws, and, except as provided in Section 21.2 above, the Parties agree to submit  any dispute to the exclusive jurisdiction of the federal and state courts sitting in New York.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement and the relationship between the Parties shall be governed by, and interpreted in accordance with New  York law without regard to provisions related to conflicts of laws, and, except as provided in Section 21.2 above, the Parties agree to submit  any dispute to the jurisdiction of the courts sitting in New York, or mutually agreed location. The Parties also reserve the right to arbitration at any time.
perturbation.explanation: The changed text introduces an ambiguity about whether the courts are the exclusive jurisdiction. Moreover, The added right to arbitration at any time contradicts the initial submission to jurisdiction, creating enforceability issues.
